text: I believe that most sophisticated financial institutions understand that the total potential relationship a borrower can bring is substantially greater than the value of the servicing strip.

label: u
text: These relationships often develop and evolve over a period of time.

label: u
text: If the financial does not meet the borrower's service level expectations the borrower is more likely to go somewhere else for the other relationships including their next mortgage.

text: Retaining mortgage customers is a critical component of managing the relationship.

label: u
text: Depending on the assumptions as to size of loan, frequency of refinancing or purchasing, future economic position of the borrower, etc. we believe the value of the relationship today is worth 4-5x the value of the servicing strip.

label: u
text: Earning this value is a very strong motivator that should result in great service.

text: Not everyone believes in the value of the relationship, but I do not think  belief is highly correlated with size.

text: One reason is simply that the value offered is generally around 20% of the value of the relationship.

text: Another even more important reason is that we believe that you cannot both focus on the value of relationships and sell servicing.

text: Buying and selling are transactions.

text: Relationships are long term investments.

text: None of the institutions we work with have ever sold servicing.

text: So one of the measures I would use to determine if an institution should be exempted is,
